Name: Additive Manufacturing Ontology
Short description: Information systems architecture,including metrics,information models,and validation methods to shorten the design-to-product cycle time in additive manufacturing (AM).
Authors/creators: Paul Witherell,Yan Lu,Jason Fox,Robert R. Lipman

Name: Automotive Industry Ontology
Short description: The Auto Ontology combines information from more related ontologies in order to create a common language to be used within the AUTO Industry.

Name: Battery Interface Ontology
Short description: Ontology providing terms and relations needed to describe things,processes,and data in the battery domain
Authors/creators: Casper Welzel Andersen,Eibar Flores,Francesca Lønstad Bleken,Jesper Friis,Simon Clark

Name: Building Ontology
Short description: The Building ontology has been developed to perform as the core module of the BIMERR project,containing information related to buidling topology,components,materials,and geometry. The geometry information is managed as information objects whitout entering in the details of the BIM model

Name: Capability and Skills Ontology based on Industry Standards
Short description: A domain ontology to describe capabilities and skills. This ontology extends the concepts defined in the CSS ontology (https://github.com/hsu-aut/css-ontology) by using ontology design patterns for different standards.

Name: Car Options Ontology
Short description: The COO provides a vocabulary for exposing available configuration options for car models. It allows indicating choices that can be made as well as compatibility,dependency,and inclusion information.

Name: Core Ontology for Robotics and Automation
Short description: It was developed within the IEEE 1872-2015 Standard Ontologies for Robotics and Automation. Specifies core conceptions of Robotics domain.
Authors/creators: IEEE RAS Ontology for Robotics and Automation Working Group (IEEE RAS ORA WG)

Name: CORAX
Short description: It was developed to provide concepts which were to general for CORA ontology,but did not exist in SUMO ontology,such as design,interaction and artifical system.
Authors/creators: IEEE RAS Ontology for Robotics and Automation Working Group (IEEE RAS ORA WG)

Name: Elemental Multiperspective Material Ontology
Short description: Elemental Multiperspective Material Ontology is a multidisciplinary effort to develop a standard representational framework (the ontology) based on current materials modelling knowledge,including physical sciences,analytical philosophy and information and communication technologies.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: Industrial Maintenance Ontology
Short description: Ontology,that covers concepts about technical,administrative and management activities and actions for maintenance information systems.

Name: Industrial Ontologies Foundry Supply Chain Reference Ontology
Short description: Supply Chain Reference Ontology (SCRO) aims to represent the generic constructs (including classes and properties) related to the domain of supply chain and logistics with focus on consistency and interoperability across supply chain- and logistics ontologies

Name: International System of Quantities
Short description: Defines physical quantities in the International System of Quantities (ISQ). ISQ was made an official ISO standard in 2009 and is defined in the ISO/IEC 80000 standard.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: oneM2M Base Ontology
Short description: oneM2M Base Ontology is the minimal ontology (i.e. mandating the least number of conventions) that is required such that other ontologies can be mapped into oneM2M.

Name: Ontology for Maintenance Procedure Documentation - Static Procedure Ontology
Short description: Ontology that captures key notions in maintenance procedure documents,to support maintenance technicians,maintenance engineers and maintenance scedulers.

Name: Ontology for the Battery Value Chain
Short description: Ontology,aiming on modeling processes along the Battery value chain. Processes are holistic perspective elements that transform inputs/educts (matter,energy,information) into output/products (matter,energy,information) with the help of tools (devices,algorithms).

Name: Position Ontology
Short description: It extends SUMO and complements CORA and was developed for capturing the main concepts and relations underlying the notions of position,orientation and pose.
Authors/creators: IEEE RAS Ontology for Robotics and Automation Working Group (IEEE RAS ORA WG)

Name: RFID System Configuration Ontology
Short description: Its purpose is to aid the identification and configuration of the right RFID system,reader or tag based on the requirements of the end-user,who can be either an RFID expert or a non-expert.
Authors/creators: Eleni Tsalapati,James Tribe,Paul A. Goodall,Robert I. Young,Thomas W. Jackson,Andrew A. West

Name: RPARTS
Short description: It was developed to provide concepts for CORA ontology to model robotic parts.
Authors/creators: IEEE RAS Ontology for Robotics and Automation Working Group (IEEE RAS ORA WG)

Name: Safety Ontology
Short description: This is an ontology for extracting the safety knowledge in industry 4.0.

Name: Semantic Sensor Network ontology
Short description: It is an ontology for describing sensors and their observations,the involved procedures,the studied features of interest,the samples used to do so,and the observed properties,as well as actuators.
Authors/creators: W3C Spatial Data on the Web Working Group

Name: Semantically Integrated Planning Model
Short description: An ontology providing semantics for capturing the knowledge of manufacturing process planning.

Name: Sensor Data ontology
Short description: The Sensor Data ontology has been developed to represent measurements generated by sensors located inside building spaces.

Name: Sensor,Observation,Sample,and Actuator
Short description: It provides a formal and general-purpose specification for modelling the interaction between the entities involved in the acts of observation,actuation,and sampling.
Authors/creators: W3C/OGC Spatial Data on the Web Working Group

Name: Smart Applications Reference Ontology
Short description: The Smart Applications REFerence ontology (SAREF) is intended to enable interoperability between solutions from different providers and among various activity sectors in the Internet of Things (IoT),thus contributing to the development of the global digital market.

Name: Smart Applications Reference Ontology extension for the Automotive domain
Short description: SAREF4AUTO is an extension of SAREF to connect it with existing ontologies (e.g. W3C SSN,W3C SOSA,GeoSPARQL,etc.) and important standardization initiatives and ontologies in the Automotive domain.

Name: Smart Applications Reference Ontology extension for building
Short description: SAREF4BLDG is an extension of the SAREF ontology that was created based on the Industry Foundation Classes (IFC) standard for building information.

Name: Smart Applications Reference Ontology extension for the Energy domain
Short description: SAREF4ENER is an extension of SAREF for the Energy domain and focuses on demand response scenarios,in which customers can offer flexibility to the Smart Grid to manage their smart home devices by means of a Customer Energy Manager (CEM).

Name: Smart Applications Reference Ontology extension for the electric grid domain
Short description: SAREF4GRID is an extension of SAREF for the smart grid domain.

Name: Smart Applications Reference Ontology extension for the industry and manufacturing domain
Short description: SAREF4INMA is an extension of SAREF for the industry and manufacturing domain to solve the lack of interoperability between various types of production equipment that produce items in a factory and,once outside the factory,between different organizations in the value chain to uniquely track back the produced items to the corresponding production equipment,batches,material and precise time in which they were manufactured.
Authors/creators: Laura Daniele,Alba Fernandez Izquierdo,Raúl Garcia-Castro,Mike de Roode

Name: Smart Applications Reference Ontology extension for the smart lifts domain
Short description: SAREF4LIFT is an extension of SAREF for the Smart Lifts domain.
Authors/creators: Maxime Lefrançois,Mauro Dragoni,Alba Fernandez Izquierdo,Raúl Garcia-Castro

Name: Vehicle Sales Ontology for Semantic Web-based E-Commerce
Short description: The Vehicle Sales Ontology is a Web vocabulary for describings cars,boats,bikes,and other vehicles for e-commerce.

Name: Versioning Ontology
Short description: VERONTO is an ontology to manage the information change of family product in time through versioning during its life cycle.

Name: Vicinity core model
Short description: This ontology represent the core terms to allow interoperability in an IoT context based on VICINITY technological solutions.
Authors/creators: María Poveda Villalón,Raúl García Castro,Fernando Serena

Name: Volkswagen Vehicles Ontology
Short description: A vocabulary for describing Volkswagen-specific features of automobiles and their components.

Name: Annotations (EMMO)
Short description: Defines annotations used in EMMO Ontology.
Authors/creators: Adham Hashibon,Emanuele Ghedini,Georg Schmitz,Gerhard Goldbeck,Jesper Friis

Name: BIO: A vocabulary for biographical information
Short description: This document describes a vocabulary for describing biographical information about people,both living and dead.

Name: Creative Commons (web.resource.org/cc/)
Short description: The CC schema lets you describe copyright licenses in RDF.

Name: Creative Commons (creativecommons.org)
Short description: The Creative Commons Rights Expression Language (ccREL) lets you describe copyright licenses in RDF.

Name: Data Catalog Vocabulary
Short description: DCAT is an RDF vocabulary designed to facilitate interoperability between data catalogs published on the Web.
Authors/creators: Riccardo Albertoni,David Browning,Simon Cox,Alejandra Gonzalez Beltran,Andrea Perego,Peter Winstanley and further contributors

Name: Dublin Core Metadata Element Set
Short description: Dublin Core is a set of fifteen main metadata items for describing digital or physical resources.

Name: Dublin Core Metadata Terms
Short description: Dublin Core is a set of fifteen main metadata items for describing digital or physical resources.

Name: Expression of Core FRBR Concepts in RDF
Short description: This vocabulary is an expression in RDF of the concepts and relations described in the IFLA report on the Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records (FRBR).

Name: Extensible Markup Language
Short description: XML is a markup language and file format for storing,transmitting,and reconstructing arbitrary data.
Authors/creators: Tim Bray,Jean Paoli,Michael Sperberg-McQueen,Eve Maler,François Yergeau,John W. Cowan

Name: Extensible Markup Language Schema
Short description: XML Schema specifies how to formally describe the elements in an Extensible Markup Language (XML) document.
Authors/creators: Shudi (Sandy) Gao 高殊镝,C. M. Sperberg-McQueen,Henry S. Thompson

Name: Friend of a Friend
Short description: FOAF is a project devoted to linking people and information using the Web.

Name: OBO Format Metamodel
Short description: OBO Format metamodel. This meta-ontology is self-describing. OBO metamodel properties are described using OBO metamodel properties.

Name: GeoSPARQL Ontology
Short description: n RDF/OWL vocabulary for representing spatial information.

Name: IEEE 1872 Annotation
Short description: Ontology for annotation properties used in IEEE1872-owl.

Name: Information Artifact Ontology
Short description: This ontology contains information entities,originally driven by work by the OBI digital entity and realizable information entity branch.

Name: Ontology for vCard
Short description: Ontology for vCard based on RFC6350.

Name: OWL-Time
Short description: OWL-Time is an OWL-2 DL ontology of temporal concepts,for describing the temporal properties of resources in the world or described in Web pages.

Name: PROV Namespace
Short description: The namespace name http://www.w3.org/ns/prov# is intended for use with the PROV family of documents that support the interchange of provenance on the web.

Name: Protégé
Short description: Information not available

Name: Resource Description Framework Concepts Vocabulary
Short description: This is the RDF Schema for the RDF vocabulary terms in the RDF Namespace,defined in RDF 1.1 Concepts.

Name: Resource Description Framework Schema Vocabulary
Short description: RDFS is set of classes with certain properties using the RDF extensible knowledge representation data model,providing basic elements for the description of ontologies.

Name: Schema.org
Short description: Schema.org is a collaborative,community activity with a mission to create,maintain,and promote schemas for structured data on the Internet,on web pages,in email messages,and beyond.

Name: SemWeb Vocab Status ontology
Short description: An RDF vocabulary for relating Semantic Web vocabulary terms to their status.

Name: Simple Feature Ontology
Short description: An OWL ontology of the Simple Features geometry types.

Name: Simple Knowledge Organization System
Short description: An RDF vocabulary for describing the basic structure and content of concept schemes such as thesauri,classification schemes,subject heading lists,taxonomies,'folksonomies',other types of controlled vocabulary,and also concept schemes embedded in glossaries and terminologies.
Authors/creators: Dave Beckett,Nikki Rogers,Alistair Miles,Sean Bechhofer,Participants in W3C's Semantic Web Deployment Working Group

Name: SPIN Modeling Vocabulary
Short description: An RDF Schema that can be used to attach constraints and rules to RDFS classes,and to encapsulate reusable SPARQL queries into functions and templates.

Name: SPIN Standard Library
Short description: A collection of generally useful SPARQL functions (expressed as SPIN functions),and SPIN templates. Also provides a top-level classification of functions,and definitions of the standard SPARQL functions.

Name: SPIN SPARQL Syntax
Short description: An RDF schema to syntactically represent SPARQL queries and update commands as RDF triples.

Name: SPIN SPIF
Short description: A library of generally useful SPARQL functions defined using SPIN.

Name: SWRLAPI
Short description: Helper classes and properties to work with SWRLAPI.

Name: VANN
Short description: This document describes a vocabulary for annotating descriptions of vocabularies with examples and usage notes.

Name: Vocabulary of a Friend
Short description: VOAF is a vocabulary specification providing elements allowing the description of vocabularies (RDFS vocabularies or OWL ontologies) used in the Linked Data Cloud,in particular it provides properties expressing the different ways such vocabularies can rely on,extend,specify,annotate or otherwise link to each other.

Name: Vocabulary of Interlinked Datasets
Short description: It is an RDF Schema vocabulary for expressing metadata about RDF datasets.

Name: Web Of Trust vocabulary
Short description: Web Of Trust (wot) RDF vocabulary,described using W3C RDF Schema and the Web Ontology Language.

Name: Web Ontology Language
Short description: The OWL 2 Web Ontology Language,informally OWL 2,is an ontology language for the Semantic Web with formally defined meaning.
